thread.title: Stephen Colbert, Sarah Silverman tell bad jokes
thread.title_full: Stephen Colbert, Sarah Silverman tell bad jokes

title: Stephen Colbert, Sarah Silverman tell bad jokes
text:
Stephen Colbert And Sarah Silverman Tell Terrible Kids Jokes Katherine Biek stephen colbert | late night | entertainment news | celebrity news | stephen colbert jokes 
Photo Credit: CBS / "The Late Show" 
When you put two comedians like Sarah Silverman and Stephen Colbert together, you just know you're going to witness a late-night segment that'll leave you in stitches. 
Colbert turned to one of his favorite sources for comedy gold: the Bad Kids Jokes Tumblr page . 
But instead of reading any jokes actually on the Tumblr account, Colbert and Silverman read some jokes that, unfortunately, just didn't make the cut. 
"There were three guys on a plane. One bit into an apple, thought it was too sweet. He threw it out the window. The second guy bit into a rock. That's it! That's terrible. Not funny," Silverman said on "The Late Show." 
Now, we did warn you that these jokes weren't funny enough to make the Bad Kids Jokes page. But it's all about the delivery, right? 
In all honesty, while the jokes that do make the cut aren't all that laugh-out-loud funny, readers do get to learn some fabulous new spellings of words. Which totally makes it worth it. 
This video includes Getty Images.
